segments.text: I see the woman drying dishes, completely oblivious to the water overflowing from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle on the floor is getting larger, and she doesn't even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the children behind her, trying to get cookies from the jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is standing on a wobbly stool, and it looks like he's about to fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is waiting for her share, her hand outstretched towards the boy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman should really pay more attention to what's going on around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is tipping, and it's making me nervous just looking at it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder why the woman doesn't hear the water running over the edge of the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so calm compared to the chaos inside the kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I should warn them, but I'm just an observer and can't interfere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is going to cause a big mess if it keeps overflowing like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the children don't get hurt while reaching for those cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR
